fawzi ahmed kanoo.title: Social Development Minister receives Bahrain Charitable Society members
fawzi ahmed kanoo.summary: Bahrain's Social Development Minister Osama bin Ahmed Khalaf Al Asfoor met with Bahrain Charitable Society Chairman Fawzi Ahmed Kanoo to discuss the society's humanitarian activities and projects. The minister commended the society's efforts and reaffirmed the ministry's support for civil organizations. Kanoo highlighted the society's goals and its commitment to partnering with other civil institutions. They also explored cooperation opportunities between the ministry and the society.
keywords: Osama bin Ahmed Khalaf Al Asfoor

fawzi ahmed kanoo.title: Social Development Minister receives Bahrain Charitable Society members
fawzi ahmed kanoo.summary: Bahrain's Social Development Minister Osama bin Ahmed Khalaf Al Asfoor met with Bahrain Charitable Society Chairman Fawzi Ahmed Kanoo to discuss the society's humanitarian activities and projects. The minister commended the society's efforts and reaffirmed the ministry's support for civil organizations. Kanoo highlighted the society's goals and its commitment to partnering with other civil institutions. They also explored cooperation opportunities between the ministry and the society.
keywords: Osama bin Ahmed Khalaf Al Asfoor

fawzi ahmed kanoo.title: Fawzi Kanoo to build mosque, hall in Bahrainâ€™s Diyar Al Muharraq
fawzi ahmed kanoo.summary: Fawzi Ahmed Kanoo, deputy chairman of Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo Group and chairman of the Bahrain Philanthropic Society, signed a construction agreement with Ahmed Alammadi, CEO of Diyar Al Muharraq, to sponsor the building of a mosque and a multipurpose hall in the megaproject. The mosque will be named after Kanooâ€™s wife, Khulood Abdulla Juma, while the hall will carry his name. Construction is set to begin in two months, aligning with the project's vision of fostering community development.

georges olivier reymond.title: Quantum computing will unleash full potential of AI: Pasqal co-founder
georges olivier reymond.summary: Pasqal, a Paris-based technology startup co-founded by Nobel Prize winner Alain Aspect, has raised over $140 million to advance quantum computing. In a discussion at the World Economic Forum, co-founder Georges-Olivier Reymond emphasized the practical applications of quantum computing for solving complex business problems, particularly in India.

georges olivier reymond.title: IBM and Pasqal Initiate Collaboration to Define Classical-Quantum Integration for Quantum-Centric Supercomputers
georges olivier reymond.summary: BM and Pasqal announced a partnership to develop quantum-centric supercomputing, combining their strengths in superconducting circuit and neutral atom-based quantum computing. The collaboration aims to foster industry adoption in chemistry and materials science, with a focus on open-source software and integration of quantum and classical computing. Both companies plan to co-sponsor a technical forum in Germany and explore best practices for utility-scale applications.

georges olivier reymond.title: French Startup Pasqal To Deploy First Quantum Computer In Saudi Arabia
georges olivier reymond.summary: Pasqal, a Paris-based quantum computing startup, has partnered with Saudi Arabia's Aramco to install the country's first quantum computer, a 200-qubit system set to be deployed in late 2025. CEO Georges-Olivier Reymond highlighted the partnership's role in accelerating the adoption of quantum technology in Saudi Arabia. Pasqal has previously sold quantum computers to France and Germany, and co-founder Alain Aspect won the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physics for foundational work in quantum mechanics.

georges olivier reymond.title: French quantum computer startup PASQAL raises 100 million euros
georges olivier reymond.summary: PASQAL, a Paris-based quantum computing startup, has raised â‚¬100 million ($109 million) in what is reported as the largest private funding round for a quantum computer startup in Europe. CEO Georges-Olivier Reymond stated that the funds will help the company deliver significant commercial advantages over classical computers by next year. The investment comes amid challenges in the sector due to stock price declines of competitors. PASQAL plans to double its workforce and is focused on enhancing its quantum computers, which currently solve complex financial optimization problems effectively. The funding was led by Temasek and included other investors such as the European Innovation Council Fund and Saudi Aramcoâ€™s Waâ€™ed Ventures.

georges olivier reymond.title: French quantum computer startup PASQAL raises 100 million euros
georges olivier reymond.summary: PASQAL, a Paris-based quantum computing startup, has raised â‚¬100 million ($109 million) in what is reported as the largest private funding round for a quantum computer startup in Europe. CEO Georges-Olivier Reymond stated that the funds will help the company deliver significant commercial advantages over classical computers by next year. The investment comes amid challenges in the sector due to stock price declines of competitors. PASQAL plans to double its workforce and is focused on enhancing its quantum computers, which currently solve complex financial optimization problems effectively. The funding was led by Temasek and included other investors such as the European Innovation Council Fund and Saudi Aramcoâ€™s Waâ€™ed Ventures.

georges olivier reymond.title: Davos 2024: AI and green transition dominate discussions
georges olivier reymond.summary: At the World Economic Forum in Davos, discussions highlighted the intersection of artificial intelligence and the green transition, featuring insights from Georges-Olivier Reymond, CEO of Pasqal, and Olivier Blum, executive vice president of Schneider Electric. The conversations explored how these critical issues are interconnected and their implications for the future.

sinopec.title: Yasref lets contract for Yanbu refinery
sinopec.summary: Saudi Aramco and Chinese firm Sinopec's joint venture, Yasref, has awarded a contract to Jacobs Engineering's Saudi subsidiary. The deal aims to optimize production at their Yanbu refinery, where Jacobs will provide extensive engineering services over three years.

sinopec.title: In a first, China has more companies on Fortune Global 500 than US
sinopec.summary: State-owned enterprises (SOEs) represented 80.2% of Chinese companies on a recently published list, up from 76.3% last year. Sinopec Group, China National Petroleum and State Grid, all SOEs, ranked in the top five.

sinopec.title: Sinopec Congratulates Saudi People on 90th National Day and Expresses Support for Saudi Vision 2030, Becomes Saudi Aramco's Largest Onshore Drilling Contractor
sinopec.summary: Sinopec, China's major petrochemical company, becomes Saudi Aramco's largest onshore drilling contractor, contributing to the exploration, development of oil and gas fields, services, and trading in Saudi Arabia. This partnership enhances bilateral trade and economic development between China and Saudi Arabia.

sinopec.title: Samref’s Yanbu refinery receives new hydrogen supplies
sinopec.summary: Saudi Aramco-China Petrochemical Corp. (Sinopec), through the Yanbu Aramco Sinopec Refining Co. Ltd.’s (Yasref), produces hydrogen pipeline supply for Mobil Yanbu Refining Co.'s Samref refinery and plans to supply three other YIC industrial firms.

sinopec.title: ExxonMobil, SABIC announce China projects
sinopec.summary: The ExxonMobil project, slated for 2023 start-up in Daya Bay, Guangdong, will feature a 1.2 million metric tons per year capacity ethylene cracker and downstream polymer facilities. ExxonMobil operates a similar project in Fujian, in collaboration with Saudi Aramco and Sinopec.

sinopec.title: China Considers Up to $10 Billion Stake in Saudi State Oil Giant’s IPO
sinopec.summary: Chinese state-owned entities, including Sinopec, are negotiating to invest $5 billion to $10 billion in Aramco's initial public offering to support the record share sale, according to sources familiar with the situation.

sinopec.title: Saudi Aramco to co-build $10B refinery in China
sinopec.summary: Saudi Aramco will supply 70% of the crude feedstock for a new complex in China, holding a 35% stake in the company. The project, involving Sinopec and due to start in 2024, is part of Aramco's strategy to make significant investments in China.

sinopec.title: Aramco's IPO has lessons for Asia's state-owned oil companies
sinopec.summary: Saudi Aramco, Saudi Arabia's state-controlled oil firm, achieved a record-breaking initial public offering in December, surpassing Apple as the world's most valuable listed company following its listing on the Riyadh stock market.

sinopec.title: These Secretive Oil Companies Control $3 Trillion In Wealth
sinopec.summary: Saudi Aramco was the most profitable company in the world in 2018, with a net income of $111.1 billion. However, in terms of annual revenue, China's state-run Sinopec led the global oil and gas industry, despite a lower net income of $9.1 billion.

sinopec.title: ZPC progresses on Phase 2 of Zhoushan integrated refining, petchem complex
sinopec.summary: Sinopec Engineering Group, a subsidiary of the Chinese company Sinopec, has completed the installation of the world's first and largest alkylation unit at Zhejiang Petrochemical's 800,000-b/d refining and petrochemical complex in Zhoushan, China.

sinopec.title: Sinopec, Aramco, and SABIC sign MoU for a petrochemical project in Saudi Arabia
sinopec.summary: Sinopec and Aramco are collaborating on projects to enhance the downstream sector in China and Saudi Arabia, aligned with Aramco's commitment to reliable energy supply. The companies aim to increase their liquids to chemicals capacity to 4 million barrels per day by 2030.

sinopec.title: Aramco, Sinopec and SABIC plan to set up greenfield petchem complex in Yanbu, Saudi Arabia
sinopec.summary: Aramco and Sinopec signed an agreement on a project in Gulei, aiming to commence a 320,000 barrels-per-day refinery and a petrochemical cracker complex by 2025. They also signed a MoU to explore the feasibility of a new petrochemical complex in Yanbu.

sinopec.title: White & Case advises Saudi Aramco on proposed refinery and petrochemical project with Sinopec
sinopec.summary: Sinopec and Saudi Aramco will commence a greenfield project, including a refining and petrochemical facility and an ethylene unit, starting operations in 2025, underscoring Aramco's long-term commitment to Asia.

pasqal.title: French startup Pasqal inks deal for Saudi Arabiaâ€™s first quantum computer
pasqal.summary: Pasqal, a Massy-based startup, has struck a deal with Saudi Arabian oil group Aramco to install Saudi Arabia's first quantum computer. This 200-qubit system will be delivered and installed by Pasqal in 2025.

pasqal.title: French quantum computer startup PASQAL raises 100 million euros
pasqal.summary: Amid a stock price collapse of three NY-listed quantum computer companies, Pasqal intends to capitalize on this situation by doubling its workforce to around 200 this year, potentially absorbing available talent.

pasqal.title: Quantum computers: French start-up Quandela raises â‚¬50 million
pasqal.summary: Pasqal, a competitor of Quandela, raised â‚¬100 million in its second funding round, marking a significant increase from the previous â‚¬25 million round. This shows renewed investor interest in quantum computing.

pasqal.title: Aramco partners with Pasqual to deploy the first quantum computer in Saudi Arabia
pasqal.summary: Pasqal and Aramco have partnered to accelerate commercial adoption of quantum computing in Saudi Arabia. The partnership reflects Aramco's contributions to the growth of the digital economy in the country.

pasqal.title: Saudi Aramco links arms with Pasqal to try out quantum computing
pasqal.summary: Pasqal is collaborating with Aramco to improve oil refining profits through quantum computing optimization models. Pasqal views this partnership as a stepping stone for future business opportunities in the Middle East.

pasqal.title: Saudi Arabia: Aramco to welcome its first 200-qubit quantum computer
pasqal.summary: Aramco, in partnership with Pasqal, aims to pioneer quantum computing in the energy sector in Saudi Arabia. The collaboration enables Aramco to utilize Pasqal's expertise to incorporate advanced solutions in their business.

yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.title: Top 100 Arab Family Businesses
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.hco: YUSUF BIN AHMED KANOO COMPANY LIMITED
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.summary: The YBA Kanoo Group, established in 1890 by Haji Yusuf, is a diversified conglomerate based in Bahrain. It operates in various sectors, including shipping, logistics, travel, industrial and energy, capital, and real estate, employing over 2,800 people. The group has over 30 joint ventures and 40 active investments across 22 countries, primarily in the Gulf region and expanding into Africa, Europe, and Asia. As of August 2022, it held a 50.5% stake in the Bahrain Ship Repairing and Engineering Company, valued at $26.5 million, and a 28% stake in Hayah Insurance Company, valued at $11.4 million.
keywords: Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Group (YBA Kanoo)

yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.title: AVIATION TECHNOLOGY & TURBINE SERVICE, INC., Plaintiff, v. YUSUF BIN AHMED KANOO CO., LTD., Defendant
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.hco: YUSUF BIN AHMED KANOO COMPANY LIMITED
keywords: Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Company, Ltd.
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.summary: The court addressed a motion by Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Company to dismiss a breach of contract complaint from Aviation Technology & Turbine Service, Inc. The plaintiff alleged that Kanoo failed to pay over $1 million for gas turbine products. The court found that service of process was improper, as the plaintiff did not meet the legal requirements for serving a foreign corporation. Additionally, the court determined that it lacked personal jurisdiction over Kanoo, as there were insufficient contacts with New Jersey and the claims did not arise from any actions directed at the state. As a result, the motion to dismiss was granted.

yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.title: HEC Secretary General meets Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo Award delegation
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.hco: YUSUF BIN AHMED KANOO COMPANY LIMITED
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.summary: On September 11, Dr. Diana Abdulkarim Al Jahromi, Secretary General of the Higher Education Council, met with a delegation from the Board of Trustees of the Yusuf bin Ahmed Kanoo Award, led by Talal Fawzi Kanoo. Dr. Al Jahromi praised the award for promoting creativity, excellence, and innovation. The discussion aimed at enhancing cooperation by increasing the awardâ€™s visibility in higher education institutions and encouraging more participation from researchers.

yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.title: Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Co. Ltd. Seeks U.S. Partners to Develop Key Economic Sectors
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.hco: YUSUF BIN AHMED KANOO COMPANY LIMITED
keywords: Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Co. Ltd.
yusuf bin ahmed kanoo company limited.summary: The U.S.-Saudi Business Council (USSBC) highlighted Yusuf Bin Ahmed Kanoo Co. Ltd. as a Platinum-level member. With over 130 years of experience, the company is a major provider of products and services to significant clients in Saudi Arabia, including Aramco, SABIC, and Maâ€™aden. Ali Abdullah Kanoo, Deputy Chairman, discussed the companyâ€™s focus on identifying new opportunities in logistics, real estate, and the industrial and energy sectors. He emphasized the potential for logistics development in Saudi Arabia and the growing demand for sustainable residential facilities driven by the young population. Kanoo is open to partnerships with American companies seeking to enter the Saudi and Gulf markets.

atkinsrealis.title: SNC-Lavalin to acquire Atkins for $3.14bn
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin Group, a Canadian construction and engineering giant, has announced its acquisition of the UK-based design and project management consultancy WS Atkins for $3.14 billion. Approved by both companies' boards, the cash deal will involve SNC-Lavalin acquiring Atkins' entire share capital at $26.88 per share. With 18,000 employees and a 2016 revenue of $2.5 billion, Atkins brings operations across the UK, Scandinavia, the US, Middle East, and Asia. SNC-Lavalin's CEO Neil Bruce highlighted that this acquisition aligns with their growth strategy, enhances service capabilities, and offers new opportunities for growth across various global regions.

atkinsrealis.title: ConsultantSNC-Lavalin completes acquisition of WS Atkins
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin has completed the acquisition of WS Atkins, forming a global, fully integrated professional services and project management company with over 50,000 employees and annual revenues of $9.24 billion. The merger strengthens SNC-Lavalinâ€™s presence in the infrastructure, rail, nuclear, and renewables markets while enhancing its revenue base and global reach. With the addition of Atkinsâ€™ 18,000 employees and established positions in the UK, Scandinavia, US, Middle East, and Asia, SNC-Lavalin aims to be among the top three firms in its sector. The acquisition is expected to improve earnings, diversify revenue streams, and create more balanced global coverage. Heath Drewett of Atkins joins SNC-Lavalin's executive committee, aiming to leverage Atkins' project management and consulting expertise within the expanded organization.

atkinsrealis.title: SNC-Lavalin to acquire Atkins
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin's acquisition of WS Atkins, approved by both companies' boards and awaiting shareholder approval, is scheduled for completion in the third quarter of this year. The acquisition price reflects a 35% premium on Atkinsâ€™ share value as of March 31. With 18,000 employees and Â£2 billion in 2016 revenue, Atkins brings diverse, complementary capabilities to three of SNC-Lavalinâ€™s four business sectors, adding value without overlapping existing services.

atkinsrealis.title: SNC-Lavalin rebrands as AtkinsRÃ©alis
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin Group, a leading professional services and project management firm, will rebrand as AtkinsRÃ©alis on September 13 to mark a transformative phase for the company. President and CEO Ian Edwards describes the rebranding as aligned with the firmâ€™s recent strategic shifts, including an exit from non-profitable sectors, a focus on high-growth markets, and a commitment to digital transformation. Based in MontrÃ©al with 36,000 employees, AtkinsRÃ©alis plans to expand through acquisitions, particularly in the US, and aims to shed unprofitable rail contracts. The new name merges 'Atkins' reflecting its 2017 acquisition, with 'RÃ©alis' highlighting its Canadian heritage and outcome-focused approach.

atkinsrealis.title: SNC-Lavalin to buy British engineering firm WS Atkins PLC for $3.6 billion
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin, based in Montreal, has announced its largest acquisition to date with the purchase of British engineering consultancy WS Atkins for $3.6 billion. Expected to close in the third quarter pending approvals, this acquisition will increase SNC-Lavalinâ€™s revenue to $12.1 billion and workforce to 53,000 employees. The deal aligns with SNC-Lavalinâ€™s growth strategy to establish itself as a global engineering and construction leader, expanding its geographic reach and diversifying its customer base. WS Atkins brings 18,000 employees and a strong presence in infrastructure and energy sectors, primarily in the UK, Scandinavia, and beyond. The acquisition, supported by SNC-Lavalinâ€™s largest shareholder, The Caisse de depot, is expected to generate $120 million in cost savings within a year, enhancing SNC-Lavalin's position in high-growth markets like infrastructure, nuclear, and transit.

atkinsrealis.title: AtkinsRealis Secures Environmental Contract in UK
atkinsrealis.summary: AtkinsRealis Group, formerly known as SNC-Lavalin, has been chosen as a partner for a significant environmental initiative with United Utilities, a major U.K. water company. The Canadian firm will design projects across water, wastewater, bio resource, and rainwater management sites for United Utilities. This partnership framework is set to last five years, with an option to extend up to 11 years, potentially yielding Â£90 million ($119.6 million) per partner if fully extended. United Utilities has appointed three design partners for this program, emphasizing a commitment to sustainable water management solutions.

atkinsrealis.title: AtkinsRÃ©alis signs deal to help modernize U.K. rail signalling system
atkinsrealis.summary: AtkinsRÃ©alis Group Inc., formerly SNC-Lavalin, has secured two contracts with Network Rail to assist in a Â£4 billion program to upgrade and digitize the U.K.'s rail signalling infrastructure over the next decade. One contract involves AtkinsRÃ©alis working independently on conventional signalling upgrades, while the other forms a joint venture with CAF to implement digital signalling. This modernization effort is expected to enhance reliability across the U.K. rail network through a blend of traditional and digital signalling solutions.

atkinsrealis.title: Corruption Case That Tarnished Trudeau Ends With SNC-Lavalinâ€™s Guilty Plea
atkinsrealis.summary: SNC-Lavalin, a Montreal-based engineering firm, pleaded guilty to bribing Libyan officials to secure contracts, resulting in a fine of 280 million Canadian dollars. This corruption case significantly impacted Prime Minister Justin Trudeauâ€™s image and re-election campaign, as accusations arose that he and his aides pressured former justice minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to settle the case favorably for the company. Although Trudeau rejected claims of misconduct, the controversy contributed to his party losing its majority in the House of Commons. The plea resolves a protracted political issue, but concerns about public interest and corporate accountability linger.

atkinsrealis.title: What Justin Trudeau Doesnâ€™t Regret in the SNC-Lavalin Affair
atkinsrealis.summary: In a recent interview, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau discussed the political challenges and controversies surrounding his handling of SNC-Lavalinâ€™s prosecution, which has impacted his political reputation. Trudeau defended his approach, emphasizing a commitment to 'doing politics differently' by attempting to bridge internal party conflicts rather than swiftly removing dissenting voices. He reflected on his approach to governance and relations with the U.S., maintaining optimism about his leadership style despite criticism. Trudeauâ€™s stance in response to this scandal showcases his focus on unity within his party and a determination to uphold a fresh, inclusive political approach in the face of opposition.

atkinsrealis.title: The Strange Story Behind the SNC-Lavalin Affair
atkinsrealis.summary: Seven years ago, SNC-Lavalin's involvement in Libya with Col. Muammar Qaddafiâ€™s regime led to significant controversy and legal repercussions. The company hired Canadian consultant Cynthia Vanier to write a report critical of NATO's actions in Libya, which resulted in her imprisonment in Mexico on charges related to attempting to smuggle Qaddafiâ€™s son. This episode highlighted SNC-Lavalin's corruption issues, resulting in executive dismissals and arrests. Years later, SNC-Lavalin's dealings in Libya became central to a political scandal involving Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. Allegations surfaced that Trudeau or his aides pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to settle the companyâ€™s bribery charges in Libya, leading to her resignation and an ethics investigation into Trudeau's actions.
